AnimaliaInsectaColeopteraCetoniidaePlatysodesverlorenispeciesWestwoodPlatysodes verloreni Westwood:Schenkling1921:357;Krikken1977:314 (holotype, ♀);Krajčik1999:43;Smetana2006:300;Legrand & Chew Kea Foo2010:89 (Crocker Range, Sabah,Malaysia), fig.263 ♀.

tax:div.tax:p: Diagnosis. This species usually has three velvety, white maculae on each elytron behind the humeral umbone, near the middle of the sutural costa, and adjoining the lateral margin. The distal declivities of the elytra with a matte area are unique to this species.

Type material examined.Holotype (by monotypy) ofAnimaliaInsectaColeopteraCetoniidaePlatysodesverloreniispeciesWestwood, 1873Platysodes verloreniiWestwood,1873 is labeled: “Blume, Java [H., yellowed label]/AnimaliaInsectaColeopteraCetoniidaePlatysodesgenusWestw.Platysodes, Westw. [H., yellowed label with red border]/AnimaliaInsectaColeopteraCetoniidaePlatysodesverloreniispeciesWestw.verlorenii, Westw. [H., yellowed label with black border]/Holotype [P., red label] /Holotype: checked, Museum Leiden [P., white label]” (♀,RMNH,Figs.11–12).

Comments ontype material. Theholotype is glued together and in poor condition. Presumably it was dissected for illustrations of mouthparts in the original publication (Fig.13). There are two words in the label of thetype specimen, “Blume” and “Java”. “Blume” probably refers to Carl Ludwig Blume (1796–1862), a German- Dutch botanist and entomologist who collected enormous amounts of specimens in theDutch East Indies (i.e.,Indonesia) and worked at Leiden (Bartelds1930).

Other material examined.INDONESIA:1 ♀ (ZMHB), Java /AnimaliaInsectaColeopteraCetoniidaePlatysodesverlorenispeciesWestw.Platysodes verloreni Westw. [H.].MALAYSIA:1 ♀ (KSCJ), Mt. Bawang, West Kalimantan,VII.1992.

Nomenclature. According to the original publication (Westwood1873), the use of the genitive ending -ii of the species name of this species is based upon a personal name, so the correct original spelling,AnimaliaInsectaColeopteraCetoniidaePlatysodesverloreniispeciesverlorenii, should be preserved as the Articles 31.1 and 33.4 (International Commission on Zoological Nomenclature1999).

Remarks.AnimaliaInsectaColeopteraCetoniidaePlatysodesverloreniispeciesPlatysodes verlorenii is the species in the genus with the most southerly distribution. No male specimen have been discovered to date.Sakai and Nagai (1998) andLegrand and Chew Kea Foo (2010) recorded two females from Borneo with a white macula behind the humeral umbone, although this maculae is not present in the femaleholotype.Legrand and Chew Kea Foo (2010) indicated that the elytral distal declivities bear a matte area, that can also be seen in the illustrations of the original publication (Westwood1873). This is a character not present in other species of the genus.
